intro: Arctostaphylos tomentosa subsp. daciticola, commonly known as the dwarf manzanita, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, grayish-white foliage and small, evergreen leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers in white or pink during the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to rocky or coastal environments. Its botanical features make it a hardy, drought-tolerant species suitable for xeriscaping.
